block.p: Gloria Jene Browne, a civil rights lawyer, and Ernie Marshall, an accountant, were married yesterday at the Sandals resort in Montego Bay, Jamaica.

Mrs. Marshall is an assistant counsel in the education section of the NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund in Manhattan and an adjunct lecturer on civil and human rights at Vassar College in Poughkeepsie, N.Y. She is also a playwright whose ''Killing Me Softly'' ran last fall at the Billie Holiday Theater in Brooklyn. A graduate of the University of Missouri at Columbia, she received a law degree from St. Louis University and a master's degree in government from the University of Pennsylvania. She is a daughter of Ardythe M. Bradshaw and William M. Browne, both of Kansas City, Mo., who are divorced.
Gloria Jene Browne, a civil rights lawyer, and Ernie Marshall, an accountant, were married yesterday at the Sandals resort in Montego Bay, Jamaica.

Mrs. Marshall is an assistant counsel in the education section of the NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund in Manhattan and an adjunct lecturer on civil and human rights at Vassar College in Poughkeepsie, N.Y. She is also a playwright whose ''Killing Me Softly'' ran last fall at the Billie Holiday Theater in Brooklyn. A graduate of the University of Missouri at Columbia, she received a law degree from St. Louis University and a master's degree in government from the University of Pennsylvania. She is a daughter of Ardythe M. Bradshaw and William M. Browne, both of Kansas City, Mo., who are divorced.

Mr. Marshall, a graduate of Baruch College, runs an accounting practice in Manhattan that also specializes in business management and e-commerce consulting. He is a son of Elizabeth T. Marshall and Maxie L. Marshall II of Manhattan, and a cousin of the late Thurgood Marshall, the Supreme Court justice.
